results.title: Dog day afternoon (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Sidney Lumet, Martin Elfand, Martin Bregman and Warner Bros Pictures
results.brief_description: On August 22, 1972, a ninety-seven degree day in New York City, an extraordinary robbery occured minutes before closing in a branch of the Chase Manhattan Bank. As the blistering day progressed, details about two incompetent robbers and their victims emerged. In a Borough, where the absurd is commonplace, these details developed into one of the most bizarre news stories of the year. Starring Al Pacino, John Cazale, James Broderick, Charles Durning and Chris Sarandon.

results.title: Doesn't everybody want a golden guitar
results.creator_credit: Lindsay Frazer, Peter Malycon, Nick Frazer, Vitascope and Film Finance Corporation Australia
results.brief_description: Every January thousands of country music fans flock to the mecca of Australian country music; Tamworth, for the annual Country Music Festival when the population swells with people united by their love for music. Hot on the wish list of performers is winning a Golden Guitar but sometimes just making an impression and being noticed is enough. This programme, previously screened on ABC, explores the phenomena of Tamworth by interviewing fans, recognised country singers such as Graeme Connors, Lee Kernaghan, Gina Jeffreys, Tommy Emmanuel, Reg Lindsay and many other up and coming stars to the country music scene.

results.title: Does Dracula Have Aids? (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: John Lander, Ken Chown and ABC-TV (Australia)
results.brief_description: AIDS is the most publicised and least understood disease in Australia. This video may help to clear up some of the confusion as the discoverer of the AIDS virus, Professor Luc Montaginier, joins Australia’s most experienced AIDS specialists and community leaders to confront the ethical and social dilemmas created by the disease. Geoffrey Robertson’s Hypothetical on AIDS was filmed on August 12, 1986.

results.title: Does it feel like a long ten minutes? (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Andrew Vial, Liz Rust and Andrew Vial Film Productions
results.brief_description: A educational program about the procedure of abortion. Shows a simulated pregnancy termination with both the doctor and the counsellor explaining the procedure to the patient.

results.title: Dodge City
results.creator_credit: Michael Curtiz and Warner Bros Pictures
results.brief_description: Michael Curtiz (Mildred Pierce, Casablanca, Angels with dirty faces) directed this star vehicle for Errol Flynn with whom he collaborated the year before on “The Adventures of Robin Hood”. In “Dodge City” Flynn plays Wade Hatton, a successful and scrupulous man who, with a loyal crew in tow, herds buffalo across Texas to various destinations. On one such trip the crew are also protecting settler families headed for Dodge City. The frontier life is depicted as dangerous and corrupt, especially in towns thriving on alcohol, gambling and prostitution. As a town with no sheriff, Dodge City is such a town - violent, lawless and ruled by the local saloon owner who murders any individual that tries to collect on honest debts. As a principled and fearless man, Hatton is implored to be sheriff and clean up Dodge City. Flynn is well cast as Hatton, a charming and handsome cowboy. Oliva de Havilland (who starred as Maid Marion in The Adventures of Robin Hood) plays his love interest Abbie Irving, a schoolteacher and journalist. As a Western intended for the Saturday matinee “Dodge City” is replete with scenes of cattle stampedes, bar room brawls and runaway trains. “Dodge City” features some glorious exterior scenes and was filmed in Technicolour.

results.title: Documentary: 1935 - 1955
results.creator_credit: Sonya Freidman, Herman J. Engel and Texture Films
results.brief_description: Part two of a three part compilation history of the documentary film. This part presents films from 1935-1955. Each sequence offers an important example of documentary film style, content and contsruction. Before each of the documentaries represented, there is an introduction that places the films historically.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Sonya Freidman, Herman J. Engel and Texture Films

results.title: Doctor Zhivago
results.creator_credit: David Lean, Carlo Ponti, United Artists Corporation and Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer
results.brief_description: Doctor Zhivago is a moving story of love and romance told against the flaming background of the Russian Revolution. The story is presented through many characters whose destinies are interwoven. Not only is it a vast panorama of a country undergoing the most radical revolution in history; it also probes, with deep and desperate concern, the personal struggle of one man’s survival. The film stars Omar Sharif and Julie Christie. A poet, a surgeon, a husband and a lover - this is the story of Zhivago. Based on the novel by Boris Pasternak.

results.title: Perfect blue
results.creator_credit: Satoshi Kon, Takeshi Washitani and Manga Entertainment
results.brief_description: Pop-idol Mimarin Kirigoe quits her struggling girl-group CHAM to pursue a career as an actress, despite the protestations of her agents and numerous fans. Her initial resolve is tested when she receives a fax labeling her a “traitor”, but she stubbornly presses on, landing a small role in the sexy television murder mystery, Double Bind. When one of her agents is injured by a letter-bomb meant for her, and the website called “Mima’s Room” starts publishing intrusively intimate details about her daily existence, Mima finds herself caught in a downward spiral of paranoid delusion and regret, struggling to separate fantasy from reality, past from present. As her world fragments into a hallucinatory nightmare, Mima must battle her own inner demons, and protect herself from an obsessed stalker, who is violently murdering her associates. Based on the suspense manga by Yoshikazu Takeuchi.

results.title: Documenting Addicus
results.brief_description: An interactive work featuring the day-today experiences of Addicus, an eccentric and lonely young man, reflected both in moving image and in text through his diary.
